items.description: This list of tools and software is intended to briefly describe some of the most important and widely-used tools related to web archiving. For more details, we recommend you refer to (and contribute to!) these excellent resources from other groups:
items.title: Tools & Software

items.description: A tool which maintains an additive archive from RSS feeds, bookmarks, and links using wget, Chrome headless, and other methods (formerly ).
items.title: ArchiveBox

items.description: A  to push web resources into on-demand web archives.
items.title: archivenow

items.description: A plugin for Chrome and other Chromium based browsers that lets you interactively archive web pages, replay them, and export them as WARC & WACZ files. Also available as an Electron based desktop application.
items.title: ArchiveWeb.Page

items.description: Python script to automatically archive social media posts, videos, and images from a Google Sheets document. Read the .
items.title: Auto Archiver

items.description: A Chromium based high-fidelity crawling system, designed to run a complex, customizable browser-based crawl in a single Docker container.
items.title: Browsertrix Crawler

items.description: A distributed web crawler (爬虫) that uses a real browser (Chrome or Chromium) to fetch pages and embedded urls and to extract links.
items.title: Brozzler

items.description: A npm package and CLI tool for saving webpages.
items.title: Cairn

items.description: Web browser with record and replay functionality.
items.title: Chronicler

items.description: Open Twitter Database and API with tools and resources for building on archived Twitter data.
items.title: Community Archive

items.description: crau is the way (most) Brazilians pronounce crawl, it's the easiest command-line tool for archiving the Web and playing archives: you just need a list of URLs.
items.title: crau

items.description: A simple web crawler in Golang.
items.title: Crawl

items.description: Crawl websites using headless Google Chrome/Chromium and save resources, static DOM snapshot and page screenshots to WARC files.
items.title: crocoite

items.description: A non-WARC-based tool which hooks into the Chrome browser and archives everything you browse making it available for offline replay.
items.title: DiskerNet

items.description: A commandline tool and Python library for archiving data from  using the .
items.title: F(b)arc

items.description: JavaScript library to turn page into static, self-contained HTML document; useful for browser extensions.
items.title: freeze-dry

items.description: The archivist's web crawler: WARC output, dashboard for all crawls, dynamic ignore patterns.
items.title: grab-site

children.description: A discussion forum for asking questions and getting answers about using Heritrix.
children.title: Heritrix Q&A

items.description: An open source, extensible, web-scale, archival quality web crawler.
items.title: Heritrix

items.description: A simple script to convert offline data into a single WARC file.
items.title: html2warc

items.description: An open source website copying utility.
items.title: HTTrack

items.description: CLI tool to save a web page as a single HTML file.
items.title: monolith

items.description: Go package and CLI tool for saving web page as single HTML file.
items.title: Obelisk

items.description: High-fidelity, browser-based, single-page web archiving library and CLI for witnessing the web.
items.title: Scoop

items.description: Browser extension for Firefox/Chrome and CLI tool to save a faithful copy of a complete page as a single HTML file.
items.title: SingleFile

items.description: A transactional archive that selectively captures and stores transactions that take place between a web client (browser) and a web server.
items.title: SiteStory

items.description: Open source software that enables users to create social media collections from Twitter, Tumblr, Flickr, and Sina Weibo public APIs.
items.title: Social Feed Manager

items.description: An  archival crawler that uses Chrome or Chrome Headless directly.
items.title: Squidwarc

items.description: A collection of resources for building low-latency, scalable web crawlers on Apache Storm.
items.title: StormCrawler

items.description: A command line tool and Python library for archiving Twitter JSON data.
items.title: twarc

items.description: A graphical user interface (GUI) atop multiple web archiving tools intended to be used as an easy way for anyone to preserve and replay web pages; , .
items.title: WAIL

items.description: WARC-writing MITM HTTP/S proxy.
items.title: Warcprox

items.description: A  extension for archiving an individual webpage or website to a WARC file.
items.title: WARCreate

items.description: An open source, dockerized, queued, high fidelity web archiver based on Squidwarc with a simple web GUI.
items.title: Warcworker

items.description: A toolkit for snapshot webpage to Internet Archive, archive.today, IPFS and beyond.
items.title: Wayback

items.description: Wayback Machine Save, CDX and availability API interface in Python and a command-line tool
items.title: Waybackpy

items.description: An easy-to-use and highly customizable crawler that enables anyone to create their own little Web archives (WARC/CDX).
items.title: Web2Warc

items.description: Open-source workflow management for selective web archiving.
items.title: Web Curator Tool

items.description: Browser extension for Firefox and Chrome which lets you archive web pages you visit.
items.title: WebMemex

items.description: An open source file retrieval utility that of .
items.title: Wget

items.description: Wget with Lua extension.
items.title: Wget-lua

items.description: A Wget-compatible (or remake/clone/replacement/alternative) web downloader and crawler.
items.title: Wpull

items.description: Web Archive (WARC) indexing and replay using .
items.title: InterPlanetary Wayback (ipwb)

items.description: The open source project aimed to develop Wayback Machine, the key software used by web archives worldwide to play back archived websites in the user's browser.
items.title: OpenWayback

items.description: A Python 3 implementation of web archival replay tools, sometimes also known as 'Wayback Machine'.
items.title: PYWB

items.description: Reconstructive is a ServiceWorker module for client-side reconstruction of composite mementos by rerouting resource requests to corresponding archived copies (JavaScript).
items.title: Reconstructive

items.description: A browser-based, fully client-side replay engine for both local and remote WARC & WACZ files. Also available as an Electron based desktop application.
items.title: ReplayWeb.page

items.description: Converts WARC files to static HTML suitable for browsing offline or rehosting.
items.title: warc2html

items.description: A webcrawler built for research uses with a graphical user interface in order to build web corpuses made of lists of web actors and maps of links between them.
items.title: hyphe

items.description: A  extension for querying Memento aggregators while browsing and integrating live-archived web navigation.
items.title: Mink

items.description: A desktop research software to be plugged on a Solr endpoint to query, retrieve, normalize and visually explore web archives.
items.title: PANDORÆ

items.description: A toolkit for searching archived webpages from , ,  and beyond.
items.title: playback

items.description: Web based archive for WHOIS and DNS records. REST API available free of charge.
items.title: SecurityTrails

items.description: Temporal web archive search based on  tags.
items.title: Tempas v1

items.description: Temporal web archive search based on links and anchor texts extracted from the German web from 1996 to 2013 (results are not limited to German pages, e.g., ).
items.title: Tempas v2

items.description: WARC and ARC full-text indexing and discovery tools, with a number of associated tools capable of using the index shown below.
items.title: webarchive-discovery

items.description: A prototype web archives exploration UI, developed with researchers as part of the .
items.title: Shine

items.description: A backend Java and frontend VUE JS project with freetext search and a build in playback engine. Require Warc files has been index with the Warc-Indexer. The web application also has a wide range of data visualization tools and data export tools that can be used on the whole webarchive.  contains all the software and dependencies in an out-of-the box solution that is easy to install.
items.title: SolrWayback

items.description: A Project Blacklight based Rails engine that supports the discovery of web archives held in the WARC and ARC formats.
items.title: Warclight

items.description: A fully functional prototype of a personal .
items.title: Wasp

items.description: Other possible options for builting a front-end are listed on in the  wiki, .
items.title: here

items.description: Collection of tools to extract and interact with WARC files (Python).
items.title: ArchiveTools

items.description: Library and CLI to consult cdx indexes and create WARC extractions of subsets. Abstracts away Common Crawl's unusual crawl structure.
items.title: cdx-toolkit

items.description: DuckDB extension to query the Internet Archive and CommonCrawl CDX APIs directly from SQL.
items.title: duckdb-web-archive-cdx

items.description: Extract web archive data using  and .
items.title: Go Get Crawl

items.description: based capture index (CDX) and WARC record server, used to index and serve WARC files (Go).
items.title: gowarcserver

items.description: Convert HTTP Archive (HAR) -> Web Archive (WARC) format (Python).
items.title: har2warc

items.description: A high-performance WARC parsing library (Python).
items.title: FastWARC

items.description: A Splitable Hadoop InputFormat for Concatenated GZIP Files (and ).
items.title: HadoopConcatGz

items.description: Read and write WARC files with a type safe API (Java).
items.title: jwarc

items.description: Libraries for reading/writing/validating WARC/ARC/GZIP files (Java).
items.title: Jwat

items.description: Tools for reading/writing/validating WARC/ARC/GZIP files (Java).
items.title: Jwat-Tools

items.description: Parse WARC files or create WARC files using either  or  (Node.js).
items.title: node-warc

items.description: Internet Archive's Sparkling Data Processing Library.
items.title: Sparkling

items.description: Command line interface to unzip WARC and WACZ files (Python).
items.title: Unwarcit

items.description: A Rust library for reading and writing WARC files.
items.title: warc

items.description: Tool and library for handling Web ARChive (WARC) files (Python).
items.title: Warcat

items.description: Command-line tool and Rust library for handling Web ARChive (WARC) files.
items.title: Warcat-rs

items.description: Streaming WARC/ARC library for fast web archive IO (Python).
items.title: warcio

items.description: Library to work with ARC and WARC files (Python).
items.title: warctools

items.description: Golang readers for ARC and WARC webarchive formats (Golang).
items.title: webarchive

items.description: Web application for distributed compute analysis of Archive-It web archive collections.
items.title: Archives Research Compute Hub

items.description: An Apache Spark framework (not only) for Web Archives that enables easy data processing, extraction as well as derivation.
items.title: ArchiveSpark

items.description: Notebooks for working with web archives with the Archives Unleashed Toolkit, and derivatives generated by the Archives Unleashed Toolkit.
items.title: Archives Unleashed Notebooks

items.description: Archives Unleashed Toolkit (AUT) is an open-source platform for analyzing web archives with Apache Spark.
items.title: Archives Unleashed Toolkit

items.description: SQL-queryable index, with CDX info plus language classification.
items.title: Common Crawl Columnar Index

items.description: A host or domain-level graph of the web, with ranking information.
items.title: Common Crawl Web Graph

items.description: A collection of notebooks using Common Crawl's various datasets.
items.title: Common Crawl Jupyter notebooks

items.description: An open-source toolkit for analyzing line-oriented JSON Twitter archives with Apache Spark.
items.title: Tweet Archvies Unleashed Toolkit

items.description: Structured data extracted from Common Crawl.
items.title: Web Data Commons

items.description: Browser extension: a link checker with more options.
items.title: Chrome Check My Links

items.description: Browser extension: basic link checker.
items.title: Chrome link checker

items.description: Browser extension: link harvester on a page.
items.title: Chrome link gopher

items.description: Browser extension: opens multiple URLs and also extracts URLs from text.
items.title: Chrome Open Multiple URLs

items.description: Browser extension: switches between browser tabs.
items.title: Chrome Revolver

items.description: Screen capture and annotation on Ubuntu.
items.title: FlameShot

items.description: For running Xenu and Notepad++ on Ubuntu.
items.title: PlayOnLinux

items.description: For running Xenu and Notepad++ on macOS.
items.title: PlayOnMac

items.description: Windows built-in for partial screen capture and annotation. On macOS you can use Command + Shift + 4 (keyboard shortcut for taking partial screen capture).

items.description: For running Xenu and Notepad++ on macOS.

items.description: Click automation on Ubuntu.

items.description: Desktop link checker for Windows.

The Web Crawl section of COPTR

items.description: The intention is that we only list services that allow web archives to be exported in standard formats (WARC or WACZ). But this is not an endorsement of these services, and readers should check and evaluate these options based on their needs.
items.title: Web Archiving Service Providers
